name: Sofitel Rio de Janeiro Copacabana

reviews.title: Great location, if a little tired
reviews.text: You certainly can't fault the location of this hotel. Right between Copacabana and Ipanema Beaches. There is a good choice of restaurants and bars - not at the cutting edge of the city, but perfectly adequate. The rooms are recently renovated and offer, smart, if not unmemorable decor. A good design feature is that due to the small bathrooms, they have ditched having a tub and opted for a large, walk in shower. This is also complimented by lovely L'Occetiane amenities. There is WiFi (which you have to pay for) and as with all Sofitels, a sumptuous breakfast buffet and wonderful selection of fresh pastries. Breakfast can also be taken on the terrace, which has spectacular views of the city, beach and Sugar Loaf Mountain. The staff are friendly and helpful - however, the Front Door Staff push the over priced hotel car, rather than calling you a taxi a little too often (insist on the latter). Overall, the hotel is a little tired - but a good option, based on price and location.

Having in mind that ALL accomodation in Rio is highly overpriced, the Sofitel is a nice surprise. Ok, the building is old and needs some refurbishing, but it is well maintained and has a pretty decor. Rooms are spacious and have fantastic views of Copacabana Beach and the Sugar Loaf. Hotel is at the tip of Copacabana, so you can easily walk to Ipanema, which makes the location unbeatable.
reviews.title: Excellent Location and Awesome views.

reviews.text: Pool is small but cozy. Breakfast is ok, I've had better in other Sofitel hotels. I have previously stayed at the Marriott, which is a fine hotel. But for the same rate, I'd choose the Sofitel again!
reviews.title: A Breathtaking View, Good Attentive Service (unusual in Rio!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my 4th visit to Rio De Janeiro and it was with trepidation that I booked a yet another different hotel. My past trips have been fine but I was crushingly disappointed with hotel staff attitude and at times shocked, they just did not care ...ATALL. Locals have told me exactly the same by the way. Check in was efficient and staff were very friendly, it was so obvious that they were well trained by a professional outfit. The room whilst on the small side and not overly modern, suddenly became very attractive when I saw the balcony and view of the beach and sugar loaf, it was stunning, no other words to describe. The only negative comment I have is that my room had a musty smell that was unpleasant when you first walked in. I did ask at reception for this to be corrected and I was assured someone had but the smell never went away, maybe my room was old, but this needs attention. I loved the fact that the hotel had a pillow menu, I slept very well.
reviews.title: Not up to Sofitel standards
Perfect
reviews.text: Location is great and the addition of the Private Beach Club on Copacabana is a wonderful idea, unfortunately this was a business trip and I did not use facilities. I would return to this hotel again, it exceeded my expectations taking into consideration the city it was in and usually a lack of attention to detail.

A great hotel in a great location. Public areas are wonderful and pools are placed well to make the most of the sun, although a bit small for fitness swimmers. It is at the fort end of Copacabana so you can easily walk to Ipanema from there.
reviews.title: Need more?

reviews.text: If you can get a sea view then you will have a wonderful vista of the whole beach and sugarloaf.
reviews.title: In need of some attention

reviews.text: There aren't many good hotels in Rio, but this is one of them.
reviews.title: More in line with a bussiness traveler's needs

reviews.text: Copacabana is also expensive so you will need to be prepared to pay for this level of accommodation.
reviews.title: good location but hotel needs refurbished

reviews.text: The whole family went for a 3 day trip to Rio and, after much research ( a lot of not so good choices in Rio at ceiling high prices) , we elected to stay at the Sofitel. We were not disapointed. The location is perfect, off Copacabana, which allows you to enjoy the beach in confort. The brunch/breakfast is outstanding and the viewfromthe room is unique.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two slight negatives though, the exterior of the hotel needs some painting and it is pricey.
reviews.title: great location smelly old rooms in need of upgrade

reviews.text: Otherwise, you cannot go wrong.
reviews.title: As expected in overpriced Rio

reviews.text: excellent location on the copacabana beach near the fort but, rooms are smelly and upholstrey and interiors to dark to brighten u up no kettle provided bathrooms is ok but badly designed everything in the hotel appears old and in need of an upgrade good breakfast
reviews.title: Great Hotel for Business Travelers looking for the traditional Rio de Janeiro

reviews.text: Oceanview was superb, overpriced, even with a corporate rate. Was very surprised during checkin to overhear staff Maria speaking negatively about brazil and rio to a elderly couple who was checking in next to me. Further inquiries confirmed she was portuguese and staff comented 'she always talks bad about rio'.....????!!!! HR should train her, her presentantion of the hotel may be good, but badmouthing the county who took her in is unaceptable in my point of view.
reviews.title: In ruins

reviews.text: My mother and I have been here for 5 nights with one more to go; she describes us as "hotel princesses" and I'd say she'd agree we've found a castle to suit us well. The rooms are beautifully designed--modern, interesting decor; comfortable bed and furniture, lovely bathroom, an abundance of amenities. Each room has its own balcony (mine has 4!) and I imagine that each has at least a sliver of a view of the ocean. The breakfast buffet is not inexpensive (50 reals) but it has an amazing selection of food. The Atlantis restaurant and Horse's Neck bar both have great views of Copacabana and offer a nice variety of light dinner choices. Yes, we love the Sofitel--but what impressed us the most was each and every employee we met. Every one is friendly, efficient, helpful--and really seems to care about the hotel and its guests . There was a minor but unfortunate incident that was the fault of the hotel; I reported it to the front desk in the morning and later that day room service arrived with a note of apology and a beautifully presented container of chocolates...and the container itself was made of chocolate!
reviews.title: My Kingdom For Sofitel Rio

reviews.text: And btw...we had a lovely chat with the hotel's general manager early in the week--he is passionate about his hotel and--unprompted--told us that comments on Tripadvisor are read and used to see what improvements can be made.
reviews.title: Beautiful spot - lovely rooms

reviews.text: I stayed here for two days on business.
reviews.title: The best in class

reviews.text: Best view imaginable from the breakfast terrace. - Sugarloaf in the distance with the Copacabana right in front - amazing!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: My room was sumptuous - amazingly comfortable bed and a rain-shower. Very Relaxing and special.
reviews.title: Attention: there are old rooms in Rio Sofitel!

reviews.text: Great hotel. Very fancy with an excellent view of Copacabana Beach. Very nice rooms and the breakfast was very good. French Press coffee is always great to have in the morning. Service staff is very helpful. There is a taxi stand right next to the hotel if you don't want to pay for a private car from the hotel. Excellent stay. A little expensive but to be honest, you are directly on Copacabana Beach so if you expected it to be cheap I would say you have unrealistic expectations of international travel.
reviews.title: Very good hotel in a desirable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is for sure in a great location and sub-par with other Sofitel hotels. The rooms are everything that she describes, tired and old - although ours didn't smell too bad. Food was good and the bed was really comfortable.
reviews.title: Agree with Linda_12_10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived after a 20 hour journey from Bolivia at 10am and as the room we had booked, the cheapest, wasn't ready we were upgraded to a suite!! The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in and we were reluctant to leave it. The bar is very nice and we ate in the upscale restuarant which was very nice, especially the desserts, my husband was delighted with the amount times he was allowed to take things from the trolley!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.text: The hotel has an area of the beach reserved for guests which is nice and feels safe as there is security there.
reviews.title: Hardly 5 stars

likes.disliked: — tropical insects in the room, wet sheets

reviews.text: The staff we met we very nice and helpful. The pool area was very quiet and is a bit drab but serves its purpose, a few more plants would make all the difference.
reviews.title: Beautiful Renovated Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel doesn't look like 5 stars hotel. The room (superior) was really small. Our tour agent said that a superiour had side beach view, and as there was no information about views at their web-page I wrote them an email asking whether it was true. No reply. Just to compare, when I wrote an email to Fairmont they answered in some hours. When we arrived we saw that our view were just roofs. But the real disappointment was waiting for us in the evening when we came back and decided to take a shower. There was a huge tropical cockroach creeping on the wall. I understand that it is a tropical country, but there are a lot of them, nd nowhere, even in Africa, I haven't seen any insects in the rooms. The reaction of the hotel stuff was like they were not surprised. They asked a manager to take a special spray and go to our room. This guy said, well, hey, it's a very small one (note -about 12 sm), sometimes they fly around. Our friends who lived in a cheaper 4 stars were laughing at us saying that it seemed the cockroaches were not fools here prefered 5 stars to 4 stars :))) Anyway, the stuff was very polite and professional. But I do not think I would like to try staying there again. The situation was very stressful.
reviews.title: Great views from the restaruant, comfortable but resting on its laurels

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Sofitel for the third time in the past two years. I have enjoyed each of my stays at this hotel. The rooms were recently renovated and are clean and elegant (with stained wood features, such as headboards and the closet units).
reviews.title: Good, solid choice!

likes.disliked: — That I couldn't get into it for hours, and for no discernible reason.

reviews.text: Had an amazing experience in this hotel. Everything was up to par from the receptionists, to the rooms, breakfast, amenities and service. The unique things about this hotel are the balconies and the proximity to the beach. I didn't see another hotel on Copacabana or neighboring Ipanema with such abundance of balconies offering breathtaking views of the ocean and the beach. All of the hotels on Copacabana and Ipanema are separated from the beach by the road. However, at the Sofitel the road narrows, bringing the hotel as close to the beach as possible and decreasing the noise from the road, which may be a problem at other hotels.They have their private beach with beach chairs, towels, massages and free cold water. The breakfast is a tropical feast with every imaginable fruit on the plate, freshly squeezed juices and pretty much any breakfast dish you may fancy. It's served on an open terrace surrounded by blooming bushes with hummingbirds flying around, though which you can see the endless ocean at the stretch of your hand. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, tasteful, with modern fixtures and impeccably clean. The staff is very friendly, courteous and helpful. I was amazed at how personable the service was. We stayed there for several days, then left to go to Iguacu for 2 days and then came back. Even though it is a huge hotel with thousands of guests daily, the moment we walked back everyone recognized us and greeted us with "Welcome back! Great to see you again!" If I had to picture a hotel in paradise this would be it!
reviews.title: Nothing beats the balconies and the location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a big hotel, right on the shores of Copacobana Beach, and 5 minutes walk to Ipanema Beach. You can't get a much better location.
reviews.title: Great location - but going through refurbishment

reviews.text: The club lounge is a bonus too. It's worth paying extra for access to the top floor lounge (for free drinks and food all day) and a view (albeit distant) of Christ the Redeemer.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the hotel is going through refurbishment at the moment. So some of the restaurants are closed at the moment. And there is building noise quite regularly during the day.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
True elegance
reviews.text: The rooms are alos fairl old and drab (with lots of wood panelling), so not the most modern hotel in the world.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights in a superior room, 8th floor, which brings (to our surprise) many benefits such as snacks and drinks and special check-in and out, etc. This means I can't comment on the other rooms, which some reviewers seem not to have been too happy about.
reviews.title: We were extremely pleased

reviews.text: Overall, we were delighted with what we got and intend to return.
reviews.title: Service Could Be Better

reviews.text: The room was not large but was very comfortable (Sofitel have excellent beds so we slept very well) and, I'm happy to say, pretty quiet. Service from everyone (and I mean everyone) we met was great. Breakfast was excellent (another reviewer here found it only average - which makes me wonder what people want) with fruits, juices, bread, freshly cooked eggs/omelets, etc. And the view at breakfast is stunning - and I've lived in Rio so I'm kind of used to it, but this was great.
reviews.title: Best hotel that I ever stayed

reviews.text: Good hotel, centrally located at the end of Copacabana and next to Ipanema.
reviews.title: Good choice, on Copacabana & next to Ipanema

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is outdated, but the rooms are nice and recently redone. I had a huge shower, with a window to the room (and blinds), a comfortable bed, efficient a/c, good windows (the street can be noisy) and a balcony with sea view (Copacabana and Sugar Loaf).
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.text: The breakfast / lunch area is at the pool side. While the pool would be nice, no one appears to like to swim next to dining people (most in business suits). But, who needs a pool with Copacabana beach just in front of the hotel?! The hotel has sun beds on the beach (not used).
reviews.title: Old hotel in a great spot

reviews.text: Breakfast is good, lunch is poor. There is an outside bar on the second floor, that is generally ok.
reviews.title: One night stay... no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rio is not a safe place and one should not wear any jewellery or watches in any pubic area. It is best to leave all valuables (including mobile phone) in the hotel safe (for free in every room) and only to take some cash (and maybe a spare debit or credit card). It is generally considered dangerous to resist any robbery.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but not exactly 5 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't want to overplay our experience - this clearly is a special hotel, catering for the wealthy. However, our time there, perhaps on account of a number of freak occurrences, was a crushing disappointment.
reviews.title: 'Dream' final night of our holiday felt more like a nightmare...
Fantastic position
reviews.text: Upon arrival, there was clearly a problem with the Mastercard link from the hotel. Neither of our credit cards would connect - given only the message 'Please Try Again'. Whilst this was unfortunate, it was clearly NOT a case of our perfectly good cards being denied by the provider. However, the member of staff seemed paralysed by this, simply trying over and again for the best part of an hour - strongly hinting that it was down to our cards or lack of means that they were failing to work (there was even a patronising attempt to reduce the amount being put onto the card to something more affordable - well I guess I was the only one in the lobby not wearing head-to-toe Ralph Lauren...). I was infuriated by being made to feel out of place and even more so by the fact we were not allowed past the desk without resolution - despite the room having been pre-paid! (This was merely a deposit taken for food/services).

An efficient hotel in perfect location. A separate lounge/breakfast lounge for the top executive floors is the best plus about this hotel. Suited for business visitors as well as tourists. Nice and flexible staff, service minded. Expensive but worth it.
reviews.title: Location, location, location - Copacabana!

reviews.text: First of all I will start my review with thank to the people working in the Lost&Found section in this hotel. I was attending a conference last week in this hotel (I was leaving in another hotel at that time) and lost my iPhone, which also had 300 USD in cash (in the holster), my Visa credit card and my Drivers' ID... Unfortunately I found out that I lost it after sometime and started searching for it in my bags and stuff...when I tried to call it, nobody answered and I didn't hear it ring anywhere near me. I was certain that it was either stolen or lost. Much to my surprise a few minutes after I got a phone call from it and a very nice lady from the Lost&Found who told me that the cleaner found my phone and gave it to them. Another few minutes later I got it back at the concierge desk. Everything was in tact! The money, ID, everything. They didn't even take a tip which I offered! Thank you very much! I would like to ask the management of the hotel to thank their staff on my behalf.
reviews.title: A pleasant experience!

reviews.text: As mentioned above I was staying in another hotel (which was a total disaster and I will write a separate review on it a bit later) and from the first day I was trying to move to an another hotel, unfortunately all were booked and overbooked, due to the RIO+20 conference. Luckily on Tuesday I was told that on Wednesday they might have a room for me for the rest of my duration of stay. And they did;). Remy (hopefully I got his name right) from the reception went a long way helping me get the room and was very helpful in all matters. We got a wonderful suite overlooking Copacabana beach with a few balconies.
reviews.title: Don't expect a great hotel in Rio...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, breakfast is magnificent, the lunch buffet is highly recommended and you will get some exceptional service in their French restaurant. The location is great, they have a Beach Service (that provides you with chairs, towels and a security guard for your belongings). Please be advised that it is better to ask the concierge if the service is working (as I understood it operates during good/sunny weather). The pools are rather small 1 meter and 1,2 meters in depth. We didn't use the massage room, so no comments about it, but I did get an impression that they have only one person during the massage, as we didn't manage to book a massage for us as a couple at the same time.
reviews.title: Great Location on Copacabana Beach
Tired 4* in overpriced Rio
reviews.text: The concierge service is ok, but they did forget to call us back once and we did have to wait twice for about 20-30 minutes for our tours (but this is not the fault of the hotel - it was the same travel agency). The delay was explained to be due to heavy traffic...

I'm generally a happy hotel camper, Irish, pretty laid back, but this one is seriously taking the mickey. Rust, mould and flooding on the balcony mean stay somewhere else. I stay 150 nights in hotels around various places - see review for Home Buenos Aires - and am quite easily pleased but this hotel is a run down kip. Some rooms have apparently been renovated but I wasn't invited to see them. Hotel Orla next door is much better and one quarter then cost. Horrible.
reviews.title: Can't believe the joke - terrible hotel

reviews.text: We stayed for only one night in a very nice deluxe room with a great view of all copacabana beach. Compliments to all the staff, specially the front desk, they did a beautiful job and they all look very professional and switched on. Congrats to Gustavo and Patricia who were very attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: One night's Sofitel Experience

reviews.text: If you´re ever in Brazil, Rio is a MUST and Sofitel Rio's Horse's Neck Bar, as well as the Atlantis restaurant, are sights worth seeing!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: I have been travelling to Brazil several times a year for over 25 years, and I have stayed at many different Hotels. I highly recommend the Sofitel in Rio.
reviews.title: Sorry But can't recomend this as a 5 star resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is at the end of Copacabana, on the beach. I will outline some of the advantages of this Hotel.
reviews.title: Loved it !

aka: Sofitel Rio De Janeiro Copacabana Hotel Rio De Janeiro
description: The location of Sofitel Rio de Janeiro Copacabana is a splendid one. It leaves the guest practically leaning over Copacabana beach – one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. It is beside Ipanema, a charming neighborhood full of attractions, immortalized in a song by Tom Jobim and Vinicius de Moraes, “Garota de Ipanema”.Sofitel Rio de Janeiro Copacabana is considered one of the most prestigious Brazilian luxury hotels, combining French savoir-faire with Carioca charm.Enjoy our comfortable apartments with balconies and the MyBed bed, the executive floor with Club Millésime services – a new concept in personalized service, beach service, two pools and many other facilities, in addition to the award winning cuisine here at Sofitel.Situated near the main business centers in the city, the hotel offers an ample and versatile Convention Center, and also a modern Board Meeting Room, a fully equipped room with a view of Copacabana beach, uniting comfort and personalized services.
